prompt: <description>**Part 1: Rectangular Prism with Cylindrical Hole** **Step 1: Create a new coordinate system** * Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Set the translation vector to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] **Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch** * Create a new face (face\\_1) * Draw the first line (line\\_1) with a start point at [0.0, 0.0] and an end point at [0.75, 0.0] * Draw the second line (line\\_2) with a start point at [0.75, 0.0] and an end point at [0.75, 0.45] * Draw the third line (line\\_3) with a start point at [0.75, 0.45] and an end point at [0.0, 0.45] * Draw the fourth line (line\\_4) with a start point at [0.0, 0.45] and an end point at [0.0, 0.0] **Step 3: Close the loop** * Loop\\_1 is closed with lines: line\\_1, line\\_2, line\\_3, and line\\_4 **Step 4: Draw the cylindrical hole** * Draw a circle (circle\\_1) with a center at [0.375, 0.225] and a radius of 0.1125 * Loop\\_2 is closed with circle\\_1 **Step 5: Scale the 2D sketch** * Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75 **Step 6: Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch** * Set the euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Set the translation vector to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] **Step 7: Extrude the 3D model** * Extrude the sketch along its normal direction by a depth of 0.375 units * This will result in a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center * The dimensions of the rectangular prism are 3 units by 2 units by 1 unit * The cylindrical hole has a diameter of 0.5 units</description>
completion:
<json>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Tapered Top and Bottom The first part is a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom. The top and bottom faces are parallel to each other, and the front and back faces are perpendicular to the top and bottom faces. The sides of the prism are straight and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the prism are approximately 3 units in length, 2 units in width, and 1 unit in height. The prism is centered on a white background. Step 1: Create a New Coordinate System Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Step 2: Draw the Sketch In the XY plane of the new coordinate system, draw the sketch for the base of the prism. The sketch is made up of a single face (face\\_1) containing a single loop (loop\\_1) with 8 linear lines. * Line 1: Start at [0.0, 0.1382] and end at [0.102, 0.1382]. * Line 2: Start at [0.102, 0.1382] and end at [0.102, 0.0]. * Line 3: Start at [0.102, 0.0] and end at [0.5099, 0.0]. * Line 4: Start at [0.5099, 0.0] and end at [0.5099, 0.1382]. * Line 5: Start at [0.5099, 0.1382] and end at [0.6118, 0.1382]. * Line 6: Start at [0.6118, 0.1382] and end at [0.6118, 0.75]. * Line 7: Start at [0.6118, 0.75] and end at [0.0, 0.75]. * Line 8: Start at [0.0, 0.75] and end at [0.0, 0.1382]. Step 3: Scale and Transform the Sketch Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75 and transform it using the coordinate system information. Step 4: Extrude the Sketch Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis by a distance of 0.3059 units in the opposite direction of the normal. Part Details Length: 0.75 units Width: 0.3059 units Height: 0.75 units</description>
